column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Denied or refused an immigration benefit application such as asylum, refugee, citizenship, extension to stay, or work permit

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Individual identified as a smuggler of persons

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: A system generated flag based on reasonable suspicion of being a smuggler

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Individual issued a final order of removal from the US by an Immigration Judge

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Removed by DHS as found inadmissible to the US based on previous felony criminal conviction in the US or other countries - includes permanent ban from entering the US

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Removed by DHS as found inadmissible to the US based on no entry documents or use of counterfeit/fraudulent documents - includes minimum of 5 year ban and up to permanent ban from entering the US

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Ordered removed by DHS, but not yet had hearing before an Immigration Judge to issue final order of removal.

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Individuals with an outstanding administrative warrant of removal from the US, but departure from the US is not confirmed

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Deported from US based on a criminal conviction (eg. drug trafficking, firearms trafficking, or serious violent crimes)

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Visa application refused or revocation that includes permanent ineligibility for admission to the US. If the subject has an entered the US after the DOS-CAT1 encounter it may be, either because the revocation is recorded against the application, or the subject has been provided a waiver.

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Encountered by DHS in an enforcement encounter including illegal entry, border turnaround, worksite enforcement, overstay, or other immigration violations

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Individual has been convicted of sexual offenses and is recorded in the Sex Offender Registry.

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Individuals denied entry or benefit for presenting as a false or assumed identity, or reasonably suspected of using an assumed identity.

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Records from individuals identified by ICE as known or suspected gang members, not resulting from a specific charge or arrest event.

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Individual has been removed from the U.S. based on a conviction of a sex offence.

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Refer to Biometric Resolution Centre for advice

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Encountered by DHS in an enforcement encounter including illegal entry, border turnaround, worksite enforcement, overstay, or other immigration violations

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Individuals known or reasonably suspected to be or have been engaged in conduct constituting, in preparation for, in aid of, or related to terrorism

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Subject is a known immigration overstay in the US

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Subject has been flagged as a potential security risk. Additional information will be requested where available; check before proceeding.

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Identities that have been flagged through research, or agency request, as significant security risks. This may also apply to travellers who have overstayed their terms of admittance, or been denied a visa to the United States under section 214(b).

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Subject has been flagged for potential immigration violations

column.name: LONG_DESCRIPTION
column.$: Identities that have been flagged through research, or agency request, as significant security risks. This may also apply to travellers who have overstayed their terms of admittance, or been denied a visa to the United States under section 214(b).
